contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Two [[submarine]]s of the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''USS ''Silversides''''', for the [[Silverside (fish)|silversides]], a small fish marked with a silvery stripe along each side of its body. *The first [[USS Silversides (SS-236)|''Silversides'' (SS-236)]], a [[Gato class submarine|''Gato''-class submarine]], served during [[World War II]]. Now a museum ship in [[Muskegon, Michigan]] *The second [[USS Silversides (SSN-679)|''Silversides'' (SSN-679)]], a [[Sturgeon class submarine|''Sturgeon''-class submarine]], served during the [[Cold War]]. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Silversides}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
